I'm 4 months sober and know my life is going in the positive direction
I've been 4 months sober. I'm doing better now with my cravings.

I've only got 5 months but I'm telling you. I'm so excited to wake up each day doing something I love. Helping other addicts who are suffering. Sobriety comes with real emotion, drive, initiative, charisma, some pain from the wreckage of our past, true insight, real friends who care about you and who you actually care about.
haven't had any opis in months

I am happy to be here, sober . I am starting to really mourn for ten years I lost to oxycontin and Xanax.

Six months ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something
Six months and some change ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something to change the way I feel.  This is the only period of sobriety I've had in 10 years.

I’m officially one year clean from opiates
I have accomplished quite a bit over days 1-5, I can't forget about that. Those are days I don't have to relive, today has been the hardest thus far.
I'm noticing glimmers... Piece by piece, glimmer by glimmer, I'm working to rebuild
Coming up on two weeks later today. I feel like I can remember every second that's passed by. ... Sleep is trying to return slowly. Not as many emotional spells. Appetite is coming back
Lookin forward to 3 weeks this weekend. Hopefully time starts to speed up a bit more

Feeling better every day, looking forward to maybe sleeping in this weekend? ... I feel like I'm trying to slowly step back into the shell of my old self that I've been hovering outside of for the last year
Hoping some of the above starts to clear out over the next week
A lot of shit I read/hear says that this should be the week of a lot of symptoms starting to subside
being off dope feels so good. this must be the last time

It's been a month and a half. I feel alive. ... It's amazing how much my life has changed for the better. I'm genuinely happy. All you guys and gals.... Stick with it. I was hopeless. If I can do it, you can.
I'm going to take my 60 day chip today
I've got 4 months clean and sober

The fact that time is so universally important in recovery can be beyond frustrating and discouraging, because you can't buy it (as we are used to doing with things we want and/or need), and you can't do anything else except to wait in order to have it.
Only as a memory that will continue to fade with time until eventually, the seductive power that those memories used to have when you first quit continues to fade as well

As I read about opiate addiction, Awake with no sleep at 5 am, I'm feeling slightly discouraged.  It's not the depression that comes with the [PAWS] territory... This is something else: it just seems like unless I completely change my life, I'm destined to fail. Has anyone else had this feeling early in the process, before talking to doctors, counselors, etc.?
first 6 days reading about how to not feel terrible

33 days clean today, and super proud of it.  I'm feeling pretty good, and every day is GETTING BETTER.  I've been hitting my outpatient program super hard, 1 on 1 every Tuesday and group 3 times a week.
You know in recovery, how they talk about that moment where it clicks? Well I had one of those.  At that moment, nothing mattered except for recovery.
ramble about shit that has absolutely no relevance to recovery
how much clean time do you have
What is one thing you wish you could have that (you feel) would make your recovery easier/better/more enjoyable?
it's about staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person
I get my 90 days 100% sober this week... MY FUCKING RECOVERY... early recovery
100+ days later and I've been to at least one meeting pretty much every day. I'm pretty confident I'd be using if it wasn't for NA
Recovery is possible. It's definitely not easy at all but I guarantee that the results are beautiful

To anyone who is in early recovery, I want to tell you that it is possible to enjoy life without drugs. I didn't believe it was possible a few months ago but as time went on and I began going to meetings and realizing what life was really about was when I became happier.
now that I’m clean. Today I’ve got 90 days.

So today I have 252 days clean (8 months 8 days). I'm also in a drug court probation program. My alternative sentence is 7 years w/ an 85% in state prison. So its safe to say I take my recovery very seriously.
they need to get to the point of desperation where they'll have a genuine desire for recovery

I only hope that come tomorrow I'll be able to continue with my plan for sobriety in the new year

getting back in to therepy and had some concerns. I've been super depressed the past few days, could this be a symptom of PAWS?

My last few posts have been about GI issues, I was being a baby and thought my body should be back to normal after just 2 mos. clean from 2 years using.  ...  Just wanted to say those looking for a timeline **I have had a solid BM once a day for 3 straight days!**  Maybe I'm lucky, but there is light at the end of the tunnel.
after the hell of withdrawal I will never go down that road again
I have been clean for two weeks now. No opiates. No drinking. No caffeine. Easy does it, being as nice to brain & body as possible.

I don't miss opiates terribly, I know they only lead to a very dark place and I don't want to go there. I sometimes feel strange, detached in a way, like I can't quite believe I quit. ... getting myself back, never going to that lost place again
I am clean, I am alive, I am beginning to feel comfortable in my skin
I am still clean. I am alive. And I am thankful
I am five weeks sober. Grouchy, tired, but desperately glad to be alive.
Six weeks was miles in the future, never thought I'd get here. Here I am. ... Hold on, guys, if you are just starting; it gets better and better.
It's been... eight weeks, I think. I feel fine. ... I am still weak, it's a long road back.
I have been clean for ten weeks and three days
I'm fine. Every day is just a day now. I don't wake up in agony, thinking about a fix constantly. I just... live.

My first month or 2 out of rehab I opened up Google Calendar and I scheduled every single thing I was going to be doing for the week, and I stuck to it. If there was more than an hour of "watching tv/playing video games," I was finding something to do, even if it meant sitting with family.
I have two years sober today
I got sober in 2014. A year later we reconnected. I helped get him County funding to get into rehab.
I have 1095 days clean today, or 3 years.

I haven't touched an opiate in almost 5 months
I'm kicking my first one month habit, between a half and full point a day. Wds have been easy but at this stage is it too late to get back to baseline?
kicked my h habit about 3 weeks ago and haven’t had the urge to use more than every now and then since
Will this set me back in my recovery
I'm over the worst why go right back. I'm just feeling trapped and depressed. But another day sober. Come on number 6
I almost feel I need to be selfish for a little while and not think of the bad I have done and focus on the good thing I am doing now

Now I have ran out of road and am now in the midst of finding a new path, one without all the obstacles. I feel like a have finally visualized a real life and what that is suppose to be composed of. I can now honestly say that I am ready to have a actual life and not this puppet show I have been putting on for everyone.
I have a long way to go I know. But it does feel good to not have opiates pumping through me. I can tell the difference. Gotta keep my mind focused. Some advice could be useful.

Feeling sooo much better. Sleep is still shit. But hit a meeting last night, great topics. Feeling good today, hopeful. Conversations are easier, crawling my ass out of bed is easier. Stay clean everybody and thank y'all for the support I have gotten here.
being sober was great motivation for the day
Stay clean. Shit tends to work out in the end.
I genuinely feel like I'm almost back to who I was before the opiates took over my life
Now I am one of those people, and you the reader with a bit of grit and hard work will be too. I look forward to reading messages similar to this when I'm at a year clean etc.
it's been about 4 months off opiates

I'm 4 weeks sober, 28 days yeah yeah!, I'm clean another day and thankful for that!, Hope everyone had a good day, and is staying sober for one more day!
I know I can stay sober one more day, and it's my hope you all will too! ... For me, it's day 31

But, I am clean, and life is good! Weather you're just starting off, restarting, or you have years of clean time, stay clean just for today. Don't give up on yourself, and keep your eye on that prize! We all can, and will, get our lives back in time.

I'm on day 43 here. Feeling pretty good, still at IOP. ... Trying to move forward, and have another day sober under my belt. ... I've never had this much clean time before. It's still a struggle at times, but when I look back its amazing how much not only my life, but myself has improved these last 6 weeks!

I have decided to go. All my friends know I am in recovery and will not be drinking with them. ... I'm going to celebrate a union though, and look forward to actually remembering my trip and the wedding. This will be the first trip I have every taken sober, and I'm really looking forward to it. ... I thank god for this change, and I can't believe how good sobriety feels. Being clear minded, making real connections with people; I'm starting to love myself again.
I've now officially moved from the rehabilitation phase, to the aftercare phase. I am in such a better place, but since I was in such bad shape my program will be easing my transition.
or even if you just have the desire to stop using post up and tell us

I'm at 105 days today... Been in a bit of a funk since right around my 90 days clean... Still going to a lot of NA meetings... Got a sponsor, and working on a 90 in 90. Meeting Tuesday to start work on my first step... Anyway, it gets a lot easier. Life's so much fucking better now even on my worst days.

I've gotten out of little 90 day funk finally! Just been doing lots of meetings, therapy, step work, and hanging out with new as well as old friends. I'm extremely thankful for my sobriety. It's been a true struggle for me to get to this point.
I'm 4 days away from my 1 year, and less than a week away from my celebration

I haven't had a dream about using in almost a month, ... I'm on track from tapering down from 16mg to 2mg of suboxone daily... I'm honestly surprised I'm doing so well solely because this is my first time ever, and statistically I should have relapsed a few times by now.
I've been to hell and back. My life is fucked...all I can say is I'm 33 days clean and will be hitting up a meeting tonight...Fuck this is hard. Buckle the fuck down and ride out the storm. Shit.

I'm doing the right thing. Doing IOP everyday, staying clean, hitting meetings daily and really trying to make progress. I'm learning to let go of the past but its so fucking hard to actually do. ... How do you guys deal with the fallout from the huge life change that is of a recovering addict?
I'm starting to have a better view on my life. The pessimism, insecurity, overwhelming feelings of inadequacy and failure as a person are starting to dissipate. I'm coming to terms with myself.

I've had amazing experiences and terrible ones. Life is both great and awful whether you're high or not, but at least when you're not it's actually real.
